messages.message: I think the main blocker to upgrading the Jenkins venv to Python 3.9 was mypy failures. Perhaps we should just do a big mypy push and then upgrade the Jenkins venv? I think the upgrade itself is pretty straightforward. I have a PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/47130) updating all the dependencies. But would need to go through every mypy / unit test failure in py-utils and fix them :disappointed:
There is also the question of how to make the fix, because the fix might make it work for Python 3.9, but the PR may fail CI because it doesn't work for Python 3.7..
